com.github.dkharrat.nexusdata.core

Class PersistentStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dkharrat.nexusdata.core.PersistentStore
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AtomicStore, IncrementalStore

    public abstract class PersistentStore
extends Object
    A PersistentStore represents the data store where the object graph is persisted. A persistent store is uniquely identified by a UUID, which is also persisted in the store along with other metadata. There are two kinds of PersistentStore:
    • AtomicStore: A store in which the entire object graph is loaded into memory and saved together all at once. This is useful when the data set is small enough where optimal performance is required
    • IncrementalStore: A store in which the object graph is loaded and saved incrementally, on demand. This is useful when working against a large dataset that is expensive to load entirely into memory, though this comes at the cost of some performance.

    • Method Detail

      • loadMetadata

        protected abstract void loadMetadata()
        Called when the PersistentStore is first loaded in order to load the store's metadata (e.g. store UUID, type, etc.). A store's metadata must at minimum contain the store's UUID, which can be set by calling setUuid(UUID).

      • getCoordinator

        public PersistentStoreCoordinator getCoordinator()
        Returns the persistent store coordinator that owns this persistent store.
        Returns:
        the persistent store coordinator that owns this persistent store

      • getLocation

        public URL getLocation()
        Returns the location where this persistent store is saved.
        Returns:
        the file where this persistent store is saved

      • getUuid

        public UUID getUuid()
        Returns the store's unique identifier. This is persisted with the store, so it's useful to identify specific store instances. Note that nothing prevents a user from copying a persistent store (and thus it's associated UUID). Therefore, you may technically encounter two stores with the same UUID if one manually made a copy of the store. Store UUIDs are used to identify ManagedObject
        Returns:
        the store's UUID

      • setUuid

        protected void setUuid(UUID uuid)
        Sets the store's unique identifier. This is used by the Store itself when loading its metadata. Once it's set, it must not change throughout the lifetime of the Store.
        Parameters:
        uuid - the UUID to use.

      • getReferenceObjectForObjectID

        protected Object getReferenceObjectForObjectID(ObjectID objectID)
        Returns the associated reference object for the specified ObjectID.
        Parameters:
        objectID - the ObjectID to get its reference object
        Returns:
        the reference object associated with the specified ObjectID

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
